item.title: [Dementhium 639] Setting an int as another int
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Yep, you thought it out for me. I don’t really care for the shop that much though.
Another problem…
I am trying to get my interface 940 (the dungeoneering store) to give me an item just for testing

case 940: if (buttonId == 64) { if (slot >= 0) { player.getInventory().addItem(18333, 1); } }
When I click on the button or a slot nothing happens…
What do you think is wrong

Btw I will never be able to have my server online. I am just working on it because I have nothing better to do.
I want someone to put it online so I can program and play with other players

Read full topic
item.source: [Dementhium 639] Setting an int as another int

item.title: [Dementhium 639] Setting an int as another int
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:3, topic:429810”]I can easily make quest give like 500 points a peice
but I want the currency to be another int like pkPoints from player.java[/quote]

Even if you make the quests give out an arbitrary amount of points, unless you keep increasing the amount of quests available, eventually people will run out of quest points.

Instead of making a shop that uses quest points as a currency, do something like the Achievements, where after a player has X amount of quest points, they can receive a special item. Although, you don’t want people only doing easy quests to get the points for great items, so you’ll have to determine an even balance between effort and reward.

Read full topic

item.title: [Dementhium 639] Setting an int as another int
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

There are… a few details that make this not a good idea. The first problem, from which all others stem, is the fact that quest points are not inherently renewable. Unless you make repeatable quests, it will not work.

Read full topic

item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

I want to make a shop using QuestPoints but I just can’t do it
Example:

int currency = 995; if (npcId == 11507) { currency = Player.getDefinition().getQuestPoints(); }
Or make the currency equal to Player.getDefinition().getQuestPoints()
